clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring of Bone Free Flaps With Microdialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Monitoring of Bone Free Flaps With Microdialysis Catheter Directly Positioned in Bone Tissue

brief_summary.textblock:
Microdialysis is admitted to be reliable by numerous surgeons to monitor flaps. Nevertheless, a few authors reported follow up with microdialysis in bone flaps, and they all described the position of the catheter in the surrounding soft tissue muscle. This surrounding soft tissue is not always the reflect of bone vascularisation.
The aim is to study the feasibility of a follow up of microanastomosed bone flaps with microdialysis. To reach this goal, investigators perform a clinical prospective research project untitled MTM project

detailed_description.textblock:
In addition to our classical clinical monitoring, bone microanastomosed flaps for reconstructive facial surgery will be monitored with CMA 70 catheter directly positioned in bone tissue.
The monitoring is recorded during 5 days. Glucose, lactate , pyruvate , glycerol rates will be analysed :
- every hour at day 1,
- every two hours at day 2,
- every three hours at day 3,4 and 5.
Data are managed with Labpilot software.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility study of monitoring bone free flaps with microdialysis (catheter directly positioned in bone tissue)
primary_outcome.description: Success of microdialysis is defined as the collection and measurement of metabolites levels as: lactate, pyruvate,glycerol and glucose.

secondary_outcome.description: Time required to acquire interpretable data after opening microdialysis circuit
Compliance rate of simples collected and analysed

other_outcome.measure: Delay of ischemia detection with metabolic parameters, compared to clinical symptoms
other_outcome.description: Time between the occurrence of the first metabolic changes and the first clinical signs of tissue damage

arm_group.description: CMA 70 catheter directly positioned in bone tissue

intervention.intervention_name: CMA 70 catheter directly positioned in bone tissue
intervention.description: At the end of the surgery the CMA microdialysis catheter is placed inside the bone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- head and neck reconstruction with iliac crest or fibula free flaps
- informed consent obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- reconstruction with other types of free flaps
